response:
The subacute presentation (over 7 days) preceded by a respiratory illness (cough), combined with markedly elevated inflammatory markers (CRP 178), strongly suggests a post-infectious or inflammatory etiology. While demyelination is a core differential, the very high CRP requires exclusion of bacterial infection.
